docs.lead_paragraph: A New Zealand drug maker says the combination of the decongestant phenylephrine and acetaminophen can raise blood pressure, but the F.D.A. says it is not a concern.

headline.main: Some Cold Medicines May Have Higher-Than-Expected Levels of a Decongestant
headline.print_headline: Some Cold Medicines Said to Magnify Levels of a Decongestant

docs.abstract: Correspondence published in the New England Journal of Medicine indicates that some widely used over-the-counter cold and flu medicines may be exposing patients to unexpectedly high amounts of decongestant phenylephrine; statement, put forward by AFT Pharmaceuticals, reveals a lapse in regulations and could raise safety concerns; Food and Drug Administration plays down findings.
docs.snippet: A New Zealand drug maker says the combination of the decongestant phenylephrine and acetaminophen can raise blood pressure, but the F.D.A. says it is not a concern.

docs.lead_paragraph: Almost half of Americans ages 40 to 75 and nearly all men over 60 qualify to consider cholesterol-lowering statin drugs under new heart disease prevention guidelines, an analysis concludes.

headline.main: Half of US Adults 40 to 75 Eligible for Statins
headline.print_headline: Half of US Adults 40 to 75 Eligible for Statins

docs.snippet: Almost half of Americans ages 40 to 75 and nearly all men over 60 qualify to consider cholesterol-lowering statin drugs under new heart disease prevention guidelines, an analysis concludes.

docs.lead_paragraph: As government financing of basic research has fallen off precipitously, philanthropists have stepped in, setting priorities and drawing both gratitude and trepidation from scientists.

headline.main: Billionaires With Big Ideas Are Privatizing American Science
headline.print_headline: Billionaires With Big Ideas Are Privatizing American Science

docs.abstract: So-called Brain initiative announced by Pres Obama underscores how American science, long a source of national power and pride, is increasingly becoming a private enterprise; as government financing of basic research has fallen off precipitously, many of America's richest philanthropists have stepped in, setting priorities and drawing both gratitude and trepidation from scientists.
docs.snippet: As government financing of basic research has fallen off precipitously, philanthropists have stepped in, setting priorities and drawing both gratitude and trepidation from scientists.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mandatory minimum sentences for firearm crimes are too harsh.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Maya Schenwar calls attention to the unjust nature of mandatory minimum sentencing for gun possession, which are particularly devastating for the poor and people of color; contends there is no good evidence that suggests mandatory minimum gun laws diminish violence, which both gun proponents and gun control advocates claim.
docs.snippet: Mandatory minimum sentences for firearm crimes are too harsh.
